actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on International Law, Immigration, and Refugees.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on International Law, Immigration, and Refugees

official_title: To amend Section 301 of the Immigration and Nationality Act.
short_title: Equal Human Rights for All American Children Act of 1992

summary.text: Equal Human Rights for All American Children Act of 1992 - Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to make any child born outside of the United States and its outlying possessions to a U.S. citizen parent a U.S. citizen at birth (without prior U.S. residence of the citizen parent). Reduces from 21 years old to six years old the maximum age at which a person of unknown parentage found in the United States can be shown to have been born outside the United States and thus lose his or her U.S. citizenship.

titles.title: Equal Human Rights for All American Children Act of 1992
To amend Section 301 of the Immigration and Nationality Act.
